column1: Great end to a wonderful Get Out The Vote day at Shane’s Texas Pit in Hampton. Like any New Hampshire small business they've adapted to the challenge of COVID with smart and creative ideas like an "Instabar" to make outdoor dining fun! https://t.co/npAFvKOxkD

It's an honor to have the support of the New Hampshire Police Association. I've been proud to work with them as we take on the COVID-19 and opioid crises and I will always fight to make sure they have the resources to do their jobs safely and effectively. https://t.co/35uOunkBhP

Small businesses like Brianna's are vital community centers particularly for our kids. If we’re going to make sure they stay open we need to make sure small businesses get adequate funding in our next COVID package. https://t.co/XGSloPRF6R

Granite Staters and millions more Americans are still struggling to pay the bills find a job and put food on the table. We should be working on a COVID-19 relief package to help them get through this crisis - not forcing through partisan judicial nominees.

We need leadership in a crisis. Trump has failed to act on COVID-19 but @CorkyForSenate has praised him from the beginning - even as hundreds of thousands lost their lives.  If he were in the Senate he’d support Trump's failed policies instead of the people of New Hampshire. https://t.co/5feW79rqnX

The White House owes America a plan to beat COVID-19 but the Trump administration doesn’t have one.  Meanwhile @CorkyForSenate has praised Trump’s response from the beginning - while ignoring the need among Granite Staters for relief aid. #WMURDebate

Getting through the COVID-19 crisis means following the science and investing in testing and tracing to get our state back on track.  Leadership means setting an example and @CorkyForSenate hasn’t demonstrated that he understands the severity of this crisis. #WMURDebate

.@ennagrazier owner of Enna Chocolate in Exeter picked up the keys to her brand new storefront in March - just as COVID-19 hit. Since then she's worked hard to adapt to the challenges of the pandemic and to turn her dream of owning her own cafe into a reality. (1/3) https://t.co/EJjMq2ROmm

Today I met with leaders at Hanover Hills Nursing Home one of many long-term care facilities hurt by COVID-19. It's unacceptable that nursing homes won't get the support they need from McConnell's relief bill & I'm fighting to make sure they get help. https://t.co/4hj8xHQpxm
Since COVID-19 hit I’ve fought for relief for our small businesses hospitals and schools. @CorkyForSenate didn’t think they needed help. #NHPR https://t.co/2BSQGZH4xl

When New Hampshire needed help to overcome COVID-19 I pushed for billions in funding for our small businesses for testing and tracing and to put people back to work.  If my opponent were in the Senate we wouldn’t have gotten any relief at all. #NHPR

Phil and Judy have owned the Chesterfield Inn for years. COVID-19 nearly put them out of businesses.  When they needed help I got to work and co-wrote the PPP legislation that helped save 24000 small businesses like theirs. I will always fight to protect NH's small businesses. https://t.co/ggLBIQJzG0

I’m honored to have the support of the New Hampshire Troopers Association. They have been on the front lines of the COVID-19 and opioid crises and I'll continue to fight for the resources they need to serve our communities safely and effectively. https://t.co/sqR3p6ddNL

The Trump tax cuts added over 1 trillion dollars to our deficit and gave tax breaks to big corporations pharmaceutical companies and special interests.  I won’t raise taxes on the middle class - I’ll fight to support them to get through the COVID crisis.

COVID-19 has been an enormous challenge for our state. Our state and local governments our hospitality industry front line hospital workers and small businesses need relief immediately. That’s what I’m fighting for in the Senate.

Sending my best wishes to the President and First Lady for a quick and full recovery from COVID-19. Millions of Americans have been affected by this virus and it's crucial that we listen to our health experts: wash your hands practice social distancing and stay safe.

It's incredible that in the middle of a pandemic that has killed more than 200000 Americans Mitch McConnell is ramming through a Supreme Court nominee instead of working with us on a COVID-19 relief package. (2/3)

200000 Americans have died to COVID-19. Congress has a responsibility to help every American struggling to get through this crisis and the need has never been more urgent.  We need a new relief bill. Here's what it ought to include (thread):

Sending my best wishes for a quick recovery to those who've contracted COVID at the Shipyard. This further underscores the need to invest in more testing and tracing to keep the virus under control. https://t.co/cgfhMkKanZ

When COVID-19 hit I reached across the aisle to do whatever it took to get small businesses the help they needed. Billions in forgivable loans have saved thousands of jobs in New Hampshire. #PPP https://t.co/eIZNI1k9O2

COVID-19 has had a disproportionate impact on communities of color in New Hampshire and across the country.  That’s why I worked with @SenatorHassan to introduce a bill that prioritizes the health and well-being of those communities in our response. https://t.co/TkCcCdDlRq
It has $1.75 billion for a new FBI headquarters that benefits one of President Trump’s hotels but it has $0 for nursing homes that have been devastated by the coronavirus in New Hampshire.

Mitch McConnell has finally released a COVID-19 bill but it doesn’t solve the real challenges Granite Staters are facing as they try to get through this crisis.  Here’s what’s in the bill and what isn’t (THREAD):

Delays of up to a week for COVID-19 tests make it difficult for us to contain the virus. In our next relief package I'm pushing for more resources for New Hampshire to reduce our testing backlog as well as provide our schools with necessary PPE. https://t.co/YvFWBthTrF

No one should have to choose between their health and their ability to participate in our democracy. Because of COVID-19 every Granite Stater will have the option to cast an absentee ballot. Click below to learn how to vote from home. https://t.co/G9m7zTWJxk

Smiths Medical is expanding its Keene facility supporting over 100 new jobs and working to make the COVID-19 vaccine accessible when it's ready. A vaccine is our best defense against the virus and New Hampshire can play a critical role in its production. https://t.co/x04BEmqLMV
Who do you think our hospitals should send their COVID-19 data to?

Thanks to Richard in Bedford for your letter. I met with school officials in Rochester today and it's clear they're going to need help as the fall approaches. Our next COVID-19 relief package has got to invest in our teachers and students. https://t.co/2ZEJnB2538

The coronavirus has already had an impact on our clean energy sector with over 1200 jobs lost in New Hampshire alone. The Senate needs to take up my bipartisan clean energy legislation to retain and expand employment in this industry. https://t.co/7FUSCBTDqt

COVID-19 and so-called “forever chemicals” make for a toxic combination. We need to understand the full effects of PFAS chemicals and the risk of exposure especially for our service members and their families to ensure they get the treatment they need. https://t.co/PNXpyD9F8C

I'm proud to have the support of @NEANHNews and to work alongside them for New Hampshire's students and teachers. I've fought to expand education opportunities from kindergarten to college and as schools adapt to COVID-19 I'll make sure they have the help they need to succeed. https://t.co/fLd34TqAZ0

Granite Staters: *everyone* will have the right to vote absentee this fall due to COVID-19.   Don’t wait until the fall to make a plan to vote. Go to https://t.co/6zED7g3L9u right now and apply for an absentee ballot 👇 https://t.co/6zED7g3L9u

We can go further: the Senate needs to take up the FAMILY Act that I co-sponsored to guarantee family leave for all parents. Particularly for our front-line workers who have given their time to fight COVID-19 we need #paidleaveforall.

Last week I called on my colleagues to take action on the twin crises facing America today: the economic fallout of COVID-19 and the racial disparities across our society. My view: https://t.co/vkk6PRioAZ

In the middle of two major crises Congress needs to take action - now. I'm calling for common-sense steps we can take to address systemic racism and to help our economy recover from the impact of COVID-19. Read below ⬇️ https://t.co/vkk6PRioAZ

COVID-19 has exacerbated another crisis in our backyard: opioid dependence. With so many people isolated and in need of support I’m pushing for our next aid package to include more funding for our substance abuse and mental health service providers. https://t.co/EL4nEcq6sF

No one seeking treatment for COVID-19 should worry about going bankrupt when they go to the hospital. But Wall Street firms are still trying to block Congress from  ending surprise medical billing.  Let's pass legislation to stop these surprise bills. Now. https://t.co/JJmjpQvMtY

This week I spoke with mayors across New Hampshire about the challenges they're facing. I'm working hard to make sure our next #COVID19 relief package includes more funding to support critical services that our cities and towns provide to Granite Staters. https://t.co/w6APOCdKwF

Especially today it’s worth remembering that we are not in this alone. As the world confronts the #COVID19 crisis nurses and health care workers in every country are stepping up to protect patients and keep us healthy. From all of us - thank you. #InternationalNursesDay

Amelia Keane is a combat medic. She is also one of several Granite Staters who traveled to NY to help treat #COVID19 patients. I’m inspired by her dedication and grateful for her service. Thank you @AmeliaMKeane! https://t.co/wZPzABvbP3

There are over 14000 nurses in NH on the front lines of the Covid-19 crisis and every day their hard work is saving lives. #ThankYouNurses for your dedication your compassion and your bravery. As you fight for us I will continue to fight for you. #NationalNursesDay https://t.co/R0C74J9Hw1

With the new COVID-19 relief bill signed into law this funding must be distributed immediately. Granite Staters can't afford to wait. It includes: ➡️$370 billion for small biz ➡️$75 billion for hospitals and health care workers ➡️$25 billion for increased testing
I'm reaching out directly to give you an update on our response to the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/oxhq1SWUbf

Some good news today: New Hampshire has received the first half ($625M) of the $1.25B federal funding from the CARES Act to fight against #COVID19.  It will help families and small businesses during these difficult times. I am working to make sure more support is on the way. https://t.co/7Yypu9WPV9

Stay-at-home orders help flatten the curve and keep us healthy. But unfortunately we've seen a rise in domestic violence reports in NH since the start of #COVID19.   The next aid package must include more funding for our vital crisis centers and prevention programs.

This #WorldHealthDay let's give thanks for the doctors nurses and health care workers on the front lines of the #COVID19 crisis.  We owe them all our deepest gratitude and I will make sure they get the tools they need to be safe and save lives. https://t.co/LKpUguXCGH
To every doctor nurse health care worker and first responder on the frontlines fighting #COVID19 and keeping our communities safe - thank you. You all are heroes.   #NationalDoctorsDay

Last night the Senate passed a bipartisan #COVID19 response bill that will provide necessary support for NH workers families small businesses hospitals & health care providers. Learn more here: https://t.co/ikwkKX1ADp

Thanks to Berlin Mayor Paul Grenier for your leadership and partnership during this challenging time. We’ll get through this by working together - everyone plays a part by helping to mitigate the spread of the coronavirus. https://t.co/n9sHlLnQ6e
.@BIAofNH is keeping an updated list of resources available to NH employers as we navigate the coronavirus here: https://t.co/ta3ycn36mX
Granite Staters: If you have questions about #COVID19 or suspect you’re exhibiting symptoms call the NH hotline by dialing 2-1-1 or 1-866-444-4211.

As part of the next #COVID19 response bill I’m negotiating bipartisan legislation to support small businesses in NH and across the country grappling with the impact of the coronavirus. We need quick bold action to fight for small businesses and workers. https://t.co/6wW4WxRHuF

With the coronavirus spreading my top priority is ensuring that Granite Staters and people across the country are staying healthy. We all have a role to play in confronting this public health crisis and keeping our communities safe. We're in this together.
